sub_fields.title: Who you’re targeting, how you’ll reach them, and why this matters for Cardano?
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
The project is aimed at beginners in Mexico and LATAM who feel interested in cryptocurrencies and ADA, but who still do not understand DeFi or trust their own ability to use it. We will reach them through digital outreach, social media, introductory educational content, and partnerships with local communities.



This initiative is important for Cardano because it transforms curiosity into real knowledge, reduces the fear of interacting with the technology, and creates new users capable of using ADA, exploring DeFi, and actively participating in the ecosystem. By opening a clear educational path, we build a base of informed users who strengthen the adoption and growth of Cardano in the region.

sub_fields.title: Provide a list of key activities of your project:
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
- Design of the course’s educational content



Creation of the beginner-oriented DeFi program, structured into simple modules with practical examples and a focus on Cardano. Includes guides, exercises, and audiovisual material.



- Production of the course in online format



Recording videos, editing, creating presentations, downloadable resources, and a student access platform. Ensures the quality and accessibility of the content.



- Preparation of free introductory material



Publishing short videos, infographics, and basic explanations to attract people who are afraid of DeFi and make it easier for them to enter the course.



- Outreach campaign in Mexico and LATAM



Promoting the program through social media, Cardano communities, local partners, and targeted ads to reach audiences interested in entering the ecosystem.



- Implementation of the course over 3 months



Delivery of the online program (10 total hours), access to modules, and follow-up sessions to resolve doubts and reinforce learning.



- Participant evaluations and feedback



Applying quizzes, measuring understanding, and analyzing progress to ensure that students gain real confidence and skills.



- Post-course follow-up and support



Optional support for students interested in continuing to deepen their knowledge of Cardano, DeFi, and ecosystem tools.



- Documentation and final project report



Collecting evidence, metrics, learnings, and results in a final report for Catalyst.

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
The project proposes creating an accessible, clear, and fully Spanish online course that teaches DeFi from scratch with a practical focus on the Cardano ecosystem. This solution directly addresses the main problem: thousands of people in Mexico and LATAM want to enter the crypto world, but fear of the technology and the lack of simple educational resources hinder their adoption.



The program is designed especially for beginners. It uses real examples, simple language, and guided exercises that allow anyone to understand how Decentralized Finance works without needing prior knowledge. In addition, the course integrates real demonstrations of Cardano usage, showing how to interact with ADA and ecosystem tools safely and responsibly.



The project will benefit new users, cryptocurrency enthusiasts, local communities, and people interested in learning without technical barriers. By offering a clear entry path, it fosters confidence and transforms curious individuals into active users. This is essential for Cardano, as it drives adoption, promotes understanding, and helps more people participate in its financial ecosystem.



What makes this solution unique is its approach fully adapted to the reality of LATAM: accessible, in Spanish, beginner-friendly, and with a direct impact on education and adoption. This course not only teaches DeFi; it opens the door for more people to use Cardano with safety, confidence, and a deep understanding of its technological value.

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer:
The project will help more people in Mexico and LATAM enter the world of Decentralized Finance without fear or confusion. Many users want to use cryptocurrencies, but the lack of clear education in Spanish holds them back. This course breaks that barrier and creates a safe, accessible, and guided entry point into Cardano.



The main impact will be transforming insecure beginners into informed users who understand how DeFi works and how to interact with ADA without risks. This generates real adoption, recurring users, new communities, and a solid foundation for ecosystem growth in the region.



Training new users, teaching good practices, and allowing them to experience DeFi clearly creates a multiplier effect: the trained individuals share their knowledge, recommend Cardano, and become natural ambassadors of the ecosystem. This strengthens Cardano’s presence in markets where education is the key to growth.



Impact KPIs



1. 100 participants enrolled in the course.
2. 70% completion of the main modules.
3. 80% satisfaction in post-course surveys.
4. 50 students completing practical exercises applied to Cardano.
5. 30% increase in interaction within Cardano–LATAM communities.
6. 3 digital communities spreading the course and participating in the program.
7. 20 students interested in continuing to learn about DeFi on Cardano.
8. A final report documenting results, learnings, and feedback.

sub_fields.title: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.description: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.answer:
The project will be carried out by a team with experience in digital education, community building, and blockchain technology outreach in Mexico and LATAM. As a Cardano ambassador, I have direct experience delivering workshops, courses, and conferences about the ecosystem, as well as collaborating with universities and tech communities. This ensures an organized, responsible, and results-oriented execution.



The course production, content structure, and learning platform will be developed using tools I already manage, supported by prior experience creating educational material. In addition, I have contacts within crypto communities in LATAM, which facilitates the program’s outreach and dissemination.



The project’s feasibility is validated through:



A clear educational plan divided into progressive modules.



Recorded content, which ensures consistency and scalability.



Evaluations and surveys that measure participants’ progress and real satisfaction.



Verifiable evidence such as metrics, feedback, and community participation.



Ongoing digital support to accompany users throughout the process.



The project can be executed with high levels of confidence because it is based on familiar tools, a proven educational format, and a clear strategy for attracting beginner users. All this, combined with the team’s prior experience in Cardano and DeFi, ensures that the objectives are met and that the results are evident and measurable.

sub_fields.title: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.description: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.answer:
In a region where interest in cryptocurrencies is enormous but the lack of education creates fear and insecurity, a clear, accessible, Spanish-language course can make the difference between a user who walks away… and one who adopts Cardano with confidence.



This budget is reasonable because it covers only the essentials: recording, editing, educational design, material production, and the creation of a community space where students can stay connected to Cardano after finishing the course. There are no inflated costs or unnecessary expenses; every ADA is transformed into concrete, useful, and long-term content.



In addition, producing 10 hours of professional educational material with this budget is highly efficient compared to common costs of digital course creation. In Mexico and LATAM, audiovisual and pedagogical production is more accessible, which allows a complete course to be created with a moderate budget and made available to the entire community.



The true value lies in what this course will generate: people who understand what Cardano is, how to use ADA, how to enter DeFi without fear, and how to take advantage of the ecosystem’s tools. This not only attracts new users; it creates natural ambassadors, multiplies adoption, and strengthens Cardano in one of the regions with the greatest growth potential in the world.



This project takes every ADA and turns it into education, confidence, and a future for Cardano in LATAM.
